CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Based on the definition , J ph equals to the difference between the current density of devices under 100 mW cm^-2 ( J L ) and that in the dark ( J D ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| J ph |
| J L (current density of devices under 100 mW cm^-2) |
| J D (current density in the dark) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| J ph |
| J L (current density of devices) |
| J D (current density in the dark) |

Note: "J ph" can be considered a physical quantity or a parameter, but it is often used to represent the photocurrent density in photovoltaic materials or devices. In this context, it can be considered a material name if we interpret it as the material or device exhibiting the photocurrent.

Note: In the given paragraph, "J ph" is the only property that clearly refers to a material property, as it represents the photocurrent density. However, if we assume that the paragraph is only about the material property of photocurrent density, then only "J ph" would be the valid entity.
